name: NPR
text:
Google CEO Sundar Pichai apologized in an internal email over the fallout of Timnit Gebru's dismissal. Thousands of employees publicly criticized the top Black scientist's ouster as "research censorship."
https://t.co/MS64PuaNKb

name: NPR
text:
Europe's soccer governing body is investigating after a Champions League official allegedly made a racist remark about a Black player. The official faces a 10-game ban if found guilty.
https://t.co/GWN1AkeFyI

name: NPR
text:
NEW: The U.S. reported more than 3,000 deaths from COVID-19, the highest daily death toll to date, as infections and hospitalizations continue to soar across the nation.
https://t.co/8kAfdxVdY1

name: NPR
text:
California's iconic old-growth redwoods ‚Äî some having survived for 1,000 to 2,000 years now ‚Äî are incredibly resilient and built to survive fires.

But even they may find it harder to rebound amid the mounting impacts of climate change.
https://t.co/IVkBcDT0D8

name: NPR
text:
Watch Paramore's Hayley Williams perform three songs ‚Äî including "Dead Horse" and "Pure Love" ‚Äî for a special Tiny Desk quarantine concert.
https://t.co/0cGKmiwz69

name: NPR
text:
Ace test pilot Chuck Yeager died on Monday. He's remembered here at NPR for his call of the first-ever landing of a U.S. space shuttle, when the Columbia touched down in California in 1981. https://t.co/Ixq1rRehnl

Thanks to our friends at @npr_rad for the clip. https://t.co/ce1ldRT3fU

name: NPR
text:
The leader of an anti-government white supremacist militia group and former sheriff's deputy has been convicted of hate crime charges after a 2017 pipe bomb attack on a Minnesota mosque.
https://t.co/fQTFvd6jF9

name: NPR
text:
Brazil's Gol Airlines is the first carrier to bring Boeing's 737 Max back into service after it was grounded over 2 deadly crashes. Gol says it will accommodate anyone who wants to avoid the plane.
https://t.co/A1RhsprPW0

name: NPR
text:
A Black state lawmaker in Michigan who faced lynching threats has been sanctioned by House Republicans for posting a video on Facebook that they say appears to threaten Trump supporters.
https://t.co/zxzXfqPu8x

name: NPR
text:
üü¢ Pre-test 1,700 passengers
üî¥ Cut trip short after passenger's positive test
üü¢ Subsequent tests on passenger + contacts all negative
üî¥ All passengers stuck on docked ship as contact tracing is finished
üî¥ Don't restart cruises in pandemic?
https://t.co/mtVaftBmiE

name: NPR
text:
On the winter solstice, Jupiter and Saturn are expected to appear closer to each other in the night sky than they have in centuries.

The Perth Observatory says the two planets last approached this closely to each other in July of 1623.
https://t.co/XUUwcdxrvq

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Joe Biden is assembling his inner circle of advisers and Cabinet officials as Inauguration Day draws closer.

We're tracking who's been named and nominated so far:
https://t.co/rJc8Un45dh

name: NPR
text:
Have you lost income and needed a mortgage forbearance or tried to get help from your landlord?

We want to hear your story. Fill out this form ‚Äî and a reporter may reach out ‚§µÔ∏è
https://t.co/hG1a1M3m3d

name: NPR
text:
Hospitals are preparing for a high-stakes COVID-19 vaccine rollout ‚Äî and there's little room for error.

"We've never done anything like this as a country or in the world, as significant as this exercise is," one hospital executive said.
https://t.co/qkMAa7fbR7

name: NPR
text:
A synthetic version of the psychedelic drug ibogaine appears to relieve depression and addiction without producing hallucinations or other dangerous side effects ‚Äî results scientists call "a promising first step."
https://t.co/VWRUit79s9

name: NPR
text:
The head of the Association of Immunization Managers says there's "no shortage of challenges" for officials planning state vaccine rollouts. One is not knowing how many doses are coming their way.
https://t.co/GvShDoC4aE

name: NPR
text:
In the past decade, both parties have attempted and failed to reinstate earmarks ‚Äî mostly because of concerns about how it would play politically. 

Despite some past abuses, some legislators see it as the best path to getting deals done again. https://t.co/jICKtIVIPv

name: NPR
text:
RT @LouderThanARiot: Nipsey Hussle‚Äôs name has been in the headlines since his death.
 
But this is the story behind Nip‚Äôs murder that hasn‚Äôt been told: how law enforcement *lied* about using the rapper‚Äôs past to sideline someone else‚Äôs future.
 
Parole. CalGang. Recidivism.
 
https://t.co/WizBec9sld https://t.co/UPDBYdbNnm

name: NPR
text:
RT @HowIBuiltThis: .@Airbnb is going public today, with a valuation of $47 billon ($68 a share).

The company started when two unemployed roommates in San Francisco had an idea for a side hustle. 

Have you heard the How I Built This episode with co-founder @JGebbia?
https://t.co/DudJ4yUQpr

name: NPR
text: RT @rob_schmitz: There's been much reporting about the problem of racism and right-wing extremism within Germany's police and security forces, but less-so about its prevention & solutions. When @ej_nicholson and I approached this story for @NPR, we focused on both (1/6): https://t.co/3MIzqGQmVD

name: NPR
text: McDonough was chosen because of his ability to navigate crises and sort through the complex morass of government programs that can support veterans, a source familiar with the president-elect's thinking told NPR. https://t.co/lHbv9I2J6K

name: NPR
text:
Unemployment claims jumped sharply last week ‚Äî as critical coronavirus aid programs, including expanded jobless benefits, are set to expire the day after Christmas.
https://t.co/tKnpNXqKvs

name: NPR
text:
Nipsey Hussle‚Äôs name has been in the headlines since his death. But @louderthanariot reveals the story behind his murder that hasn‚Äôt been told: how law enforcement lied about using the rapper‚Äôs past to sideline someone else‚Äôs future. 

LISTEN: üîä https://t.co/xnJjoPVwAY https://t.co/B41e6oBZlr

name: NPR
text:
.@HowIBuiltThis host @GuyRaz is interviewing @joinReel Co-founder and CEO Daniela Corrente. They're covering debt, savings, and shopping.

Are you considering a big purchase? What's your plan?

Supported by @WGU. #HIBTLive https://t.co/aohLNJkBZ7

name: NPR
text:
Airbnb is making its stock market debut today, even as the coronavirus continues to take its toll on the travel industry.

The company's offering price is $68 a share, which would value Airbnb at $47 billion.
https://t.co/Vtk0wJx2WK

name: NPR
text:
The Supreme Court has unanimously ruled that Muslims put on the no-fly list after refusing to act as informants can sue federal officials for monetary damages under the Religious Freedom Restoration Act.
https://t.co/kZWZhiUlGO

name: NPR
text:
RT @throughlineNPR: The Supreme Court has the final say, it determines the law of the land - but has it been always this way?

This week, the origins of the highest court in the U.S. and how it became truly supreme: https://t.co/GC4PeCLewv https://t.co/CRtjF3vb6R

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden intends to nominate Denis McDonough to run Veterans Affairs. McDonough is a longtime aide of former President Obama and served as his chief of staff from 2013 to 2017.
https://t.co/RCYe6f5NlQ

name: NPR
text:
Historians for Johns Hopkins University have discovered that the school's founder enslaved people as late as 1850 ‚Äî contrary to the long-held belief that he was a staunch abolitionist.
https://t.co/Q6Vmq4SOhi

name: NPR
text:
A majority of American sports fans believe people should not be playing team sports indoors, a new NPR poll finds.

And 56% said they were concerned or very concerned that it will spread the coronavirus in their local community.
https://t.co/NLKXrm5sKw

name: NPR
text:
The Minneapolis City Council voted to shift nearly $8 million in police funding ‚Äî a small part of a $179 million overall police budget ‚Äî to other services, including violence prevention.

But, facing a veto threat, it opted against staff cuts to the force. https://t.co/ovFpJ2GiFB

name: NPR
text:
Mark Zuckerberg and Elon Musk became centibillionaires this year, bringing the total to 5.

They're not alone in getting richer.

The collective wealth of the 651 U.S. billionaires is up by over $1 trillion roughly since the pandemic began, a report finds. https://t.co/RefF6NQbsO

name: NPR
text:
"It's not anything to celebrate. It's kind of a disturbing milestone," says Chuck Collins from the Institute for Policy Studies. 

"But I think it's a predictable outcome of four decades of flat wages and steadily concentrating wealth and power." https://t.co/Djgcz9rarm

name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden will inherit a fragile economy and a possibly uncooperative Congress, raising questions about what he can do on his own to bolster an economic recovery.

Here are some things experts say he can do via executive action:
https://t.co/CL3e6o0nwM

name: NPR
text:
RT @KQEDnews: Pass it on: 

Tuesday (Dec 15) is the last day to sign up for health insurance via the #AffordableCareAct (a.k.a. #Obamacare.)

https://t.co/t0uFJvq1NP

name: NPR
text: Virtually no nation recognizes Morocco's sovereignty over Western Sahara. The change in U.S. policy on the former Spanish colony took officials at the U.N. by surprise. https://t.co/GBswawtvGg

name: NPR
text:
FDA advisers are meeting to weigh the benefits and risks of clearing Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use in the U.S.

Watch live: https://t.co/tfDrGwsrDz

name: NPR
text: Ellen DeGeneres has tested positive for the coronavirus. Her talk show ‚Äî which has allowed a small in-studio audience since late October ‚Äî is on hold until January. https://t.co/IXoCHioqC2

name: NPR
text:
Incoming Biden climate envoy John Kerry said rejoining the Paris climate accords is just the first step.

He expects to spend much of 2021 working toward an already scheduled climate summit in November.
https://t.co/LTkfFxFUwA

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRItsBeenAMin: This is what @WNYCStudios @deathsexmoney host @annasale had to say about coping with pandemic fatigue

Check out our ep. on how COVID has tested friendships: https://t.co/PYLsxlAeSY & head to the DSM feed for a story on falling in love while apart: https://t.co/gnboidZauS https://t.co/V66A92KkEr

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: JUST IN: A panel of experts have voted to recommend the FDA authorize the Pfizer and BioNTech coronavirus vaccine for emergency use.

name: NPR
text:
Kids and teens have had their lives upended by the pandemic ‚Äî and many report feelings of frustration, sadness and anxiety.

Here are some tips on how you can help them get through this difficult time. (@nprlifekit)
https://t.co/4zjfDBQNLN
